pons_p79 wrote:
> 
> 
> I had one problem when developing test case for complex queries.
> Query is working fine.But when there is no such data in the table, it
> returns null value.
> How can I compare this using "assert" methods.
> 
> For eg: I want to test one method which will execute a complex query
> and returns a list of records.
> the size of the return list may vary.
> 
> public List findAll() -> when no data in the table it will
> retun null.

Before we talk about the test, why return null instead of an empty list?

> In testcase I coded like this
> 
> List myList = dao.findAll();
> assertTrue("No records found",myList .size() >0)
> 
> when I have done like this, it throws NullPointerExeption because the
> list is zero.
> If any one know the solution how to implement, please answer to me. :)

With your design, you want assertTrue(myList == null). JUnit has a 
shortcut for this: assertNull(myList).

But still, I really think you should consider returning an empty list 
instead of null.
